de.mpa.client.settings

Class FilterSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mpa.client.settings.FilterSettings

  • public class FilterSettings
extends Object
    Class for storing spectrum filtering-related variables and methods.
    Author:
    A. Behne

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FilterSettings(int minPeaks, double minTIC, double minSNR, double noiseLvl)
      Creates a filter settings object from the specified minimum peak count, minimum total ion current value, the minimum signal-to-noise ratio and the noise threshold.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMinPeaks()
      Returns the minimum peak count
      double getMinSNR()
      Returns the minimum signal-to-noise ratio.
      double getMinTIC()
      Returns the minimum total ion current
      double getNoiseLvl()
      Returns the intensity level below which peaks are considered to be noise.
      boolean matches(int peaks, double tic, double snr)
      Returns whether the specified values meet the stored filter criteria.
      void setMinPeaks(int minPeaks)
      Sets the minimum peak count
      void setMinSNR(double minSNR)
      Sets the minimum signal-to-noise ratio.
      void setMinTIC(double minTIC)
      Sets the minimum total ion current
      void setNoiseLvl(double noiseLvl)
      Sets the intensity level below which peaks are considered to be noise.

      • FilterSettings

        public FilterSettings(int minPeaks,
                      double minTIC,
                      double minSNR,
                      double noiseLvl)
        Creates a filter settings object from the specified minimum peak count, minimum total ion current value, the minimum signal-to-noise ratio and the noise threshold.
        Parameters:
        minPeaks - the minimum peak count
        minTIC - the minimum total ion current
        minSNR - the minimum signal-to-noise ratio
        noiseLvl - the intensity level below which peaks are considered to be noise

      • matches

        public boolean matches(int peaks,
                       double tic,
                       double snr)
        Returns whether the specified values meet the stored filter criteria.
        Parameters:
        peaks - the peak count
        tic - the total ion current
        snr - the signal-to-noise ratio
        Returns:
        true if the stored criteria are met, false otherwise.
